entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is mentioned as the one who said 'Night, Mr Weasley' and also had a conversation with Mrs Weasley about the clock in the washing basket. He is described as pushing back his chair and seeing Mrs Weasley glance at the clock.

entities.name: mr weasley
entities.description: Mr Weasley is mentioned as being greeted by Harry with 'Night, Mr Weasley' and also responding to Harry's greeting. He is described as having a conversation with Harry about the clock in the washing basket.

entities.name: crookshanks
entities.description: Crookshanks is mentioned as leaping from Mr Weasley's lap and slinking out of the room. He is described as a cat.

entities.name: fred and george
entities.description: Fred and George are mentioned as having a bedroom on the second floor. They are described as twins who share a room.

entities.name: mrs weasley
entities.description: Mrs Weasley is mentioned as glancing at the clock in the washing basket and also pointing her wand at a lamp to ignite it. She is described as having a conversation with Harry about the clock.

entities.name: washing basket
entities.description: The washing basket is mentioned as containing a clock that Mrs Weasley glances at. It is described as an unusual place to put a clock.

entities.name: lamp
entities.description: The lamp is mentioned as being pointed at by Mrs Weasley's wand and igniting immediately. It is described as bathing the room in a pleasant golden glow.

entities.name: vase of flowers
entities.description: The vase of flowers is mentioned as having been placed on a desk in front of a small window and emitting perfume that cannot disguise the lingering smell of gunpowder. It is described as being large.

entities.name: clock
entities.description: The clock is mentioned as being at mortal peril according to Mrs Weasley's glance at it. It is described as having all its hands at mortal peril.

relationships.description: Harry greets Mr Weasley with 'Night, Mr Weasley' and Mr Weasley responds to Harry's greeting. This is described in the text as a conversation between the two.
Harry has a conversation with Mrs Weasley about the clock in the washing basket. This is described in the text as Harry seeing Mrs Weasley glance at the clock.
Mr Weasley responds to Harry's greeting with 'G'night, Harry'. This is described in the text as a conversation between the two.
Mrs Weasley points her wand at the lamp and it ignites immediately. This is described in the text as Mrs Weasley using magic to turn on the lamp.
